intro: Coniogramme rubescens, commonly known as the red-veined nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members commonly referred to as nettles. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with reddish veins and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Coniogramme rubescens is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
